result.execSummary:
The defendant Gabriel Lane Schroeder was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Gabriel Lane Schroeder is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Gabriel Lane Schroeder was found guilty of Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
1) The defendant will have no further contacts w/law enforcement during term of agrmt. that give rise to probable cause for arrest due to criminal conduct.
2)Defendant shall notify Pepin County District Attorney's Office of any change of residence or employment.
3)One month prior to completion of contract, defendant must contact Pepin County District Attorney's Office for a final interview.
4)Report in person as requested by the Pepin County District Attorney or other supervisor designated by him.
5) The defendant must follow the rules and regulations as set forth by probation, if applicable.
ADDITIONAL CONDITIONS:
A.  I understand that a probation violation will be considered a violation of this agreement.  I will immediately inform the DA's Office of any probation violations.
B.  The defendant will comply with all existing conditions of bail.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Pepin County Case No. 2017CM24.

miscConds.notes: To be paid according to a schedule as set forth by Probation & Parole.

Defendant Gabriel Lane Schroeder in court with attorney Francis Xavier Rivard.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Here on sentencing after revocation in 17CM24 and sentencing on motion to revoke DPA in 16CF18.  Atty Rivard confirms receipt of the PSI, has reviewed with his client and no corrections.  State confirms complied with victim notification requirements and informs there are no victim impact statements but the victim is present.  State's closing arguments, won't recommend prison, recommends 9 mos. jail with credit of 172 days on the revocation case and in 16CF18 recommend following PSI recommendation of 3 yrs probation, 6 mos. jail, credit of 87 days.  Atty Rivard closing arguments and argues incarceration not necessary.  On the 2 misdemeanor cases, Court sentences defendant to 260 days in the PCJ with credit for 172 days served; enter judgment of $2709 for restitution to victim; enter judgment for unpaid court costs; on CF case w/hold sentence and place defendant on 5 yrs. probation consecutive to 17CM24; no credit on the consecutive case; conditions of probation: pay restitution of $2709.00 to victims; waive costs; no possession or consumption of controlled substance w/o prescription; comply with any assessment or counseling set up by P&P; demonstrate responsibility by seeking or maintaining F/T employment or education; order DNA sample.  Advised of felony prohibitions.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on December 4, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Gabriel Lane Schroeder in court with attorney Francis Xavier Rivard.  Defendant Gabriel Lane Schroeder in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  2 matters before the court, State's motion to revoke DPA on felony and Restitution Hrg. in 17CM24.  Parties have had discussions, if court revokes DPA, State requests court order PSI then sentence both on the felony and misdeameanor charges at the same time; defendant has pending criminal matters in Eau Claire and Chippewa Counties; Mr. Schroeder withdraws his objection to restitution figure of the Bonns; Auto Owners Ins. has claim of $3479.67 which Atty Rivard will argue they are not a direct victim.   Defendant agrees with restitution figure due Bonns of $2709.00, court determines restitution of $2709.00, and decline to order restitution for Auto Owners based on ability to pay.  Defendant does not contest revocation of DPA.  Court revokes DPA, accepts defendant's plea and finds him guilty on count 1.  State requests PSI, defendant on warrant status in 2 other counties.  Court orders PSI.  Referred to JA for scheduling sentencing hearings on 2 charges @ 60 days out.  Defendant to contact the SPD and request representation on probation revocation and revocation of DPA.
Motion hearing on October 10, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
Motion hearing on August 29, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
State's Motion to Revoke DAGPA

Defendant Gabriel Lane Schroeder in court with attorney Francis Xavier Rivard.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court requests defendant to update his address for the record.  388 Red Cedar St. Apt. 111, Menomonie, WI.  Counsel informs resolution reached, defendant will plead to count 1 as DPA, plead NC to 2 misdemeanor thefts in complaint to be filed, other charges will be dismissed, joint recommendation 2 yrs. probation, argue jail; there is an issue on restitution.  Request sentencing on another date, however victims are here today and have filed VIS.   Court requests copy of complaint from State as it hasn't come through yet.  Court advises defendant of new misdeameanor charges/max. penalties; advised of felony charge/max. penalties, felony prohibitions and advised defendant of his constitutional rights.  To new misdemeanor charge in count 1 defendant pleads guilty; to count 2 defendant pleads guilty, subject to the DPA on the burglary charge in 16CF18, defendant pleads guilty.  PLQ/WOR form filed with the court and reviewed with defendant.  Court finds defendant's waiver of his constitutional rights and plea done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts pleas and finds defendant guilty and defers plea on the felony charge and approves the DPA.  Court informs the victims he's read the VIS and inquired if there is anything else they want court to know.  Victim, M.B. addressed the court.  Referred to JA for scheduling.
Restitution Information
Plea hearing on April 10, 2017 at 03:15 pm.

Atty Francis Rivard appt'd.

Defendant Gabriel L Schroeder in court, in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court confirms defendant received copy of criminal complaint, advises of charges/max. penalties and constitutional rights and right to preliminary hrg. w/in 10 days if in custody, 20 days it not.  State notes defendant 18 yrs. old in DHS, ties to community, 2 serious felonies, gravity offense, protection to public request $1000 cash bond.  Defendant informs court he does not have $1000.  Court informs defendant he can make some phone calls subject to jail rules.  Set $1000 cash bond, other conditions:  show up in court and no other criminal violations.
